I have had a number of policies over the years with Heymondo and most of my experiences with them have been worrisome.  In looking at the reviews below, I notice that the majority of the positive comments relate to the purchasing of the travel policy - at which Heymondo does an admittedly good job - but there seem to be quite a number of negative posts about the claims process and which, after all, should be the preeminent consideration of any traveler. Putting the missives of 'haters' aside, I believe that the concern is legitimate considering 1. it is literally impossible to get anybody from Heymondo on a call; 2. the Heymondo policy is subject to Spanish law (which might be problematic for many travelers) and 3. in the case of British travelers, my impression is that the Heymondo policy is not subject to the oversight of the UK's Financial Conduct Authority. As mentioned above, best that buyers be aware and carefully comparison shop.FURTHER UPDATE:In reply to Heymondo's reply, in my experience I have never been able to get anyone from Heymondo on a call and I am happy to stand corrected. That said, in the case of a dispute, the fact that the policy is subject to Spanish law - regardless of the residence of the policyholder - is an important point for buyers as is the fact that British policyholders do not benefit from FCA oversight. I believe that both these points are true statements and should be flagged to potential purchasers.

I was then prescribed an antibiotic, which I made a separate claim for and I was reimbursed the following business day.Overall, this was a pretty positive experience and I don't have any serious complaints. The biggest frustration is that over the course of the day I dealt with 3 or 4 different 'consultants' but the benefit here is that the process was outsourced to an office familiar with healthcare in the US. HOWEVER, when dealing with the insurance provider called Axa, and you are in the middle of an emergency, and it takes 25 hours to get confirmation of your coverage, (i.e. after you have already been admitted into the hospital and you have no choice, and you are totally stressed about how you're going to pay if they deny your coverage), and no one calls you and no one answers your e-mails, and the app doesn't allow you to send your number to an Axa agent for them to call you, you can only call them, which is not always possible, it can get pretty frustrating.And when you get no guarantees of coverage from Axa, only a strange e-mail talking about "pre-existing diseases", when you are in the hospital due to an injury from a fall, it is all pretty aggravating and stressful Even the hospital said, "Ohhh, yeah Axa is REALLY slow."The agent I was speaking to at Hey Mondo, Vanessa, was really great, but they have nothing to do with any of the decisions or the time it takes for the actual insurance company to do anything. Axa was very disappointing. In the end, they took care of everything, so I am pleased about that, but the stress was ridiculous.Hey Mondo should work with a more reliable insurance company or they will lose clients, ultimately. No one needs this kind of stress in a medical crisis, let alone a life or death situation. Hey Mondo did well, Axa was a real nightmare to deal with. I think I was just lucky that they couldn't deny my claim.One thing about Hey Mondo, though. I never received an e-mail with confirmation of my policy purchase. I searched for it when I needed to get my policy number, but they had never sent anything! And strangely, they also never sent anything saying my policy was about to expire and did I want to renew it. I only noticed it was due to expire THAT DAY because I went searching for the information because I needed to open a case file. And even while talking to them about opening a case file, no one noticed it was due to expire in 6 hours!!! It was me that said, "Wait, is this going to expire today??!!" I was just super lucky that I noticed! I wasn't too impressed with that.

Please beware of the Covid19 coverage, it is useless. You will be better off not having any (unless required by countries you are travelling to).I took out the Heymondo policy to protect me during the sailing trip for two reasons: (1) activity cover and (2) Covid19 cover for non-refundable expenses. Before boarding the sailing boat, I have tested positive on Covid19, I had to cancel the trip and forced to quarantine in the hotel. I have been denied both reimbursement of the trip and extra expenses related to the quarantine stay on the pretext that my trip already started! That even though I would have been happy to only get reimbursed for the trip itself. I am shocked, after ruined time, never stepping on the boat, sitting between four walls in the hotel and 1 month of back and forth with Heymondo, I am down eur 80 which I paid for the Heymondo premium travel insurance!I strongly suggest you use different providers who are honest about their offering if even it comes at a bit of premium!REPLY TO BELOW:1) One thing is to have a nice interface, other is to actually be helpful with the claims. A reason I purchased the insurance was to cover a non-refundable trip (as per provided on the invoice). I am shocked that the insurance provider is passing on the responsibility to the trip operator!2) Heymondo does not offer any specific carve-out to their policy which would enable a trip start in a different country where you have to travel on personal expense. Indeed, most of the airlines, commercial hotels provide some rebooking flexibility (which means Heymondo passes on the responsibility). Also, most countries where you can travel are a low risk due to strict Covid 19 policy. Considering this, Heymondo is unlikely to need to settle any Covid19 related claim (except for medical hospitalisation - very unlikely unless you are in the high-risk group).3) I received a reply from the claim handling team (customer service never got back), bluntly denying any request to settle any claim besides medical expense. This means Heymondo seems to not even cover costs of self-isolation - meaning despite having an official document which disables any travel and mandates 10-day isolation - costs are coming out of my pocket on top of the cancelled trip and Heymondo insurance premium?! So if you hope to reduce any risk of Covid19, this policy is useless.
